title: Should I major in criminal justice and minor in psychology or the opposite way around? - Quora

response.answer_text: Psychology is a really interesting field where a minor can carry extremely high value. Some really good schools, including Stanford (the #1 school of psychology in the country), will admit students into their PhD program that have a bachelors in a major that is not psychology. The emphasis will be on research, some prerequisite psychology material, experience, etc., but the actual major isn’t a requirement. So what value does that major have? Well, some schools do require the major, some areas (e.g. chemical dependency professional) can be worked in with just the bachelors degree, etc. In general though, I think the combination won’t matter as much either way because the minor in each field will get you most of the main classes in the subject, so there’s definitely no “wrong” decision there. I’d say just take more of whatever grabs your interest the most.

Thank you, so much my friend, for considering a career in law enforcement. Good Evening. Before selecting a major field of study, may I suggest you contact the human resources of numerous police departments, especially in those areas you would like to be employed? Ask them what would be their opinion on a prospective candidate, most likely to be hired. I wish you all the luck in the world, my friend. I hope you have a pleasant Evening.
